summary: Interactive 3D cafe website with contour-line topographic theme, now including clickable furniture items and a more realistic/scan-like 3D cafe environment (beyond simple clicking), plus menu/about/contact pages and a downloadable package for WordPress Elementor use.
architectural_notes: Clickable/interactable furniture objects should have distinct visual states (default/hover/active) consistent with contour-line theme.
Consider pipeline/asset approach for scan-like environment (photogrammetry or scan-inspired modeling) balanced against web performance constraints.
In-scene navigation props (menu card/coffee cup) should be clearly labeled (Menu/About/Contact) and support click/tap to open corresponding site sections/pages.
known_issues: Deployment/build process failed during deployment ("Something went wrong with the deployment").

existing_features.title: Implement immersive 3D navigation controls in the main 3D cafe scene so users can move through the space (not just click): support keyboard movement (WASD/arrow keys), mouse/touch look, and smooth camera transitions between navigation modes (e.g., orbit overview to walk-through).

Add proximity- and gaze/hover-based interactions in the 3D cafe so interactions can be triggered by movement/attention instead of clicks (e.g., entering a zone reveals contextual UI, hovering highlights objects, looking at a point of interest for a short dwell time triggers an info card).

Implement object interaction mechanics that feel physical/immersive (e.g., doors that open when approached, draggable/rotatable small props, or a “pick up / inspect” interaction) with smooth animations and constraints to prevent clipping or breaking the scene.
Create the interactive 3D navigable cafe experience with a consistent contour-line (topographic) visual theme and smooth animations across the site.
Add site pages/sections for Menu, About, and Contact, integrated with the 3D experience (e.g., reachable via in-scene interactions and also via standard navigation UI).

Provide a downloadable package/version suitable for WordPress Elementor use, including clear instructions for how to embed or serve the built frontend assets (and any limitations around canister-backed features).

Apply a coherent visual design system for the entire app (colors, typography, layout, motion) that complements a cozy cafe + topographic contour-line aesthetic and remains consistent across 3D overlays and standard pages.
Add a lightweight in-app onboarding overlay that teaches non-click 3D interactions (movement, look/hover, proximity triggers) and can be dismissed and re-opened.

Make select cafe furniture meshes in the 3D scene directly clickable/hoverable (at minimum: the counter and both tables), with pointer hover feedback and click behavior implemented on the actual furniture meshes (not only on POI markers).
Apply a topographic/contour-line visual style to the clickable/interactable furniture items so they read like map contour lines, while preserving the rest of the scene’s warm cafe look.

Upgrade the main cafe environment to feel closer to a realistic 3D scan (more believable geometry and materials/lighting), while keeping the overall contour/topographic aesthetic compatible with the existing site style.

Verify and, if necessary, update the frontend-backend type alignment for `ContactMessage` so the frontend builds cleanly and React Query hooks (`useGetContactMessages`, `useSubmitContactMessage`) work after the backend fix.

Add a minimal deployment validation step/checklist to ensure the project’s standard deployment flow completes (backend deploy + frontend build), and ensure any deployment-time errors are surfaced with actionable logs/messages.

Add additional non-interactive furniture meshes to populate the 3D cafe scene (beyond the current counter and two tables), keeping materials/lighting consistent with the existing warm cafe + contour/topographic aesthetic.
Add an in-scene 3D “Menu” prop (e.g., a menu card or coffee cup) that is clearly labeled with the exact text "Menu" and opens the Menu panel when clicked/tapped.
Add an in-scene 3D “About” prop that is clearly labeled with the exact text "About" and opens the About panel when clicked/tapped.
Add an in-scene 3D “Contact” prop that is clearly labeled with the exact text "Contact" and opens the Contact panel when clicked/tapped.
Remove the front/initial popup shown on site load by disabling the automatic first-visit onboarding modal from opening when the app loads.

Upgrade the main 3D cafe environment so it feels more like an actual cafe by replacing the most placeholder-looking primitive furniture (e.g., simple cylinders/boxes for tables, stools, counter) with more believable cafe furniture geometry and materials, while preserving the existing warm cafe + contour/topographic visual identity.

Improve the in-scene “Menu” coffee cup prop so it looks clearly like a coffee cup placed on/near the counter and is clearly labeled with the exact text "Menu" from normal viewing angles, while keeping existing click/tap behavior to open the Menu panel.

Add additional cafe “proper furniture and other things” as non-interactive scene dressing (e.g., barista/coffee equipment, display items, decor) placed in sensible cafe locations (counter/back wall/seating area) to make the space feel lived-in, without adding new UI panels or new navigation concepts.

new_feature_requests.summary: Implement richer 3D interactions beyond simple clicking (e.g., navigation, object interaction, immersive triggers) in the 3D cafe experience.
Create an interactive 3D navigable cafe space with contour-line visual theme and smooth animations.
Add site pages: Menu, About, Contact.
Provide a downloadable package/version suitable for WordPress Elementor use.
Implement backend support for site content and contact submissions using a single Motoko actor (e.g., query methods for menu/about content and an update method to submit contact messages).
Make select cafe furniture items clickable/interactable in the 3D scene (e.g., tables, chairs, counter) with associated responses (highlight/info/trigger).
Apply contour-line (topographic map) styling to clickable/interactable furniture items so they visually match the map-like contour theme.
Upgrade the main cafe environment to feel like a proper 3D scan (more realistic geometry/materials/lighting while retaining the contour-line aesthetic where needed).

Fix the Motoko backend contact message storage so the canister compiles and can be deployed successfully (replace the current use of `List.empty` with a mutable/stable structure and update `submitContactMessage` and `getContactMessages` accordingly).
Add in-scene 3D UI props (e.g., a menu card or coffee cup) labeled “Menu”, “About”, and “Contact” that can be clicked/tapped to open the corresponding pages.
Add additional furniture assets to populate the cafe scene (beyond existing items), integrated into the environment.
Remove the front/initial popup shown on site load (disable or delete the front popup overlay).

projectName: Immersive 3D cafe experience with richer interactions (beyond clicking)
